statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Northern Arizona 102, Idaho St. 98, 2OT
article.story: POCATELLO, Idaho (AP)-Tyrone Bazy had 25 points and a career-high seven assists, and Ruben Boykin, Jr. added 20 points and 10 rebounds to lead Northern Arizona to a 102-98 double-overtime win over Idaho State on Thursday night. Idaho State (10-12, 5-4 Big Sky) used a hot-shooting first half to take a 37-32 halftime lead. The Bengals hit 8-of-11 from 3-point range in the opening half, including their first six attempts. After Idaho State extended its lead to 43-35 early in the second half, Northern Arizona (12-10, 7-4) went on an 11-0 run, capped by a pair of free throws by Bazy, to go ahead 46-43. Two free throws by Kyle Landry with just more than two minutes to play gave the Lumberjacks a seemingly comfortable 75-66 lead, but Idaho State ended regulation play with a 10-1 run to tie the score at 76 and force the first overtime. The teams played to a stalemate in the first overtime and headed to a second overtime tied at 84. A 3-pointer by Stephen Sir with just more than two minutes left in the second overtime gave Northern Arizona a 91-88 lead, and the Lumberjacks led the rest of the way. Idaho State had six players score in double-figures, led by a season-high 21 from Matt Stucki and a career-high 20 from Austin Kilpatrick. Sir added 19 for Northern Arizona.
